column1: The present study addressed three issues raised by Ellis's paper: Clarify whether necessitous thinking has been neglected by other cognitive theorists, test empirically the role of necessitou thinking in depression relative to other established cognitive constructs, e.g., the cognitive triad (Beck, 1967), and determine whether necessitous thinking is particularly salient in depression as compared with other forms of psychopathology.
